summary: 03/00/1993: The Irish Republican Army (IRA) attempted to assassinate a former member of the security forces. The assailants took the occupants of a neighboring home hostage overnight. The nine year old boy of the former member of the security forces was slightly injured in the attack. No casualties resulted from the incident.
target1: Former member of the Security Forces
addnotes: One injury and no casualties resulted from the incident.
scite1: “Car Bomb Tears the Heart Out of A Town,” Daily Mail (London), March 8, 1993.
scite2: “Four policemen injured in IRA car bomb blast,” The Herald, March 8, 1993.
scite3: Martin Cowley, “Four injured in explosion,” The Irish Times, March 8, 1993.
